title: How to Make a Windows XP Bootable Disk Using a ISO File

methods.name: Burning a CD Using Power ISO

steps.headline: Download PowerISO, And install it.
steps.description: You might have to restart your computer after the installation.

steps.headline: Double click on your ISO file you want to burn.
Use the CD drive to boot from the CD.

methods.name: Mounting a CD Using Power ISO

steps.headline: Right click on the ISO file you want to mount.
steps.description: > Go to PowerISO> Set number of drives> For example 1 drives.

steps.headline: Right click on your ISO file you want to mount.
steps.description: > Go to PowerISO> Mount IMG to drive [Letter] >

steps.headline: Go to My Computer.
steps.description: You will see your mounted CD.

tyn: A computer running XP or later
A disk large enough to hold your .ISO

Click on Burn again.  Use the CD drive to boot from the CD.  Mounting a CD Using Power ISO Download PowerISO, and install it.  Right click on the ISO file you want to mount. > Go to PowerISO> Set number of drives> For example 1 drives. Right click on your ISO file you want to mount. > Go to PowerISO> Mount IMG to drive [Letter] > Go to My Computer. You will see your mounted CD.
